Reviews.Title: “For Mexico City it's good but that doesn't say a lot.”
Reviews.Author: Matt P
Reviews.Content: If this were a US hotel I would not stay there. But this isn't the US. The service is EXCEPTIONAL. The rest is average and a bit worn out. The WiFi is horrible but it's the same at every other hotel I've stayed at in Mexico City. At least they don't charge you for it here like the rest of the hotels. If effort alone made the hotel they would be 5+ stars but unfortunately they get a 3/5 overall.

Reviews.Title: “Big clean hotel, lacks ambience .. and has dodgy internet”
Reviews.Author: bluetoffee316
Reviews.Content: It's big clean hotel, business traveller class and very nice and helpful and freindly staff. Restaurant is average, not bad but not particularly good. Bar is in the foyer and lacks any real character; it also closes at 11pm, which is quite early!! Located next to Perisur mall and near to where I am working it is very convenient. The gym is small and not very well equipped, for example the bikes are very old, and the weight machine has 3 stacks for 5 stations, meaning lots of alternating with people if it is busy. Travelling for business, my main beef is that the internet capability is VERY bad. Wireless only and no ethernet backup, the wireless has been basically unusable for 4 days which is unacceptable. If this continues (they say it will be fixed today, a Sunday \ holiday, so I am sceptical) I will be finding alternative accommodations for the next 2 months.

Reviews.Title: “Radison Paraiso”
Reviews.Author: Aventurero2010
Reviews.Content: If you are in the Southern Mexico City for business, for University matters, nothing beats this chain hotel. Located across the street from Perisur (a gigantic mall), short blocks away from the old paper mill converted into a beautiful series of remodeled old buildings or a short taxi ride to the amazing Ciudad Universitaria (worth a visit even if you have no business there). The rooms are generous in space and well kept, the staff is extremely friendly and helpful, breakfast is typical Mexican buffet and there are innumerable taxis at the door. The ride to the airport was smooth. Highly recommended. The posted rate is expensive buut I doubt that anyone pays that rate. The University has an excellent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Near Mall But Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: RolandofGilliad
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because you could walk to the very nice mall (and a Starbucks). However, I was disappointed with the experience. While the lobby is nice, the rooms need work. Thin carpet and smallish rooms were a problem. I had to move once because the rooms facing the freeway and the mall were too noisy. The staff was very helpful in this move. Food was not as good as the Royal Pedregal just down the street and although I liked being able to walk to the mall, I wouldn't say here again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in my life”
Reviews.Author: albatr0s8web
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel in my life. That is even worse by taking into account its category and number of "stars". Indeed, apart from the scarce lighting due to exahusted and not replaced lamps, when we came back to our room the second day of our stay we found that the Hotel reused the same USED AND DIRTY towels we used the day before, and on which we walked over. There were very big dirty spots. However, they put again the towels well folded as they were new! EVEN WORSE: Before checking out, I WAS OBLIGED to pay a tip. Now, apart from the fact that in Mexico this is not the rule, and in any case that must be a my choice, what they did is incredible= on a my ALREADY SIGNED and PAID BILL, THEY ADDED the tip amount by themselves. When I said that I had already paid, they answered that there is a tip indicated over my signature!

Reviews.Title: “Good option if you have to work nearby”
Reviews.Author: mcaetano70
Reviews.Content: This is a very good property and its quality is similar to another Radisson hotel. This hotel is well suited for business travelers who will have to work nearby the hotel. I do not recommend if your intention is to make a leisure trip since it is distant for major touristic attraction in Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: sd316
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times over the past 10+ years and have seen many good changes. the service by all staff has always been excellent. From bellman to bartender to housekeeping and everything in between. All that I have come in contact with have done there job very well. Many thanks to them all for several successful trips. Location is great for south end of city. Nice parks near by. Great shopping & food just across bridge. & all very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: SeattleElikapeka
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel just can't be beat. Without exception they are friendly and helpful without being intrusive. Since I was only here for two days and had lots of work to do, I ended up eating most of my meals in the hotel. Room service was incredibly quick, the restaurant was very pleasant, and the food was very good. My room was good-sized, and nicely decorated. There are no special or extra touches, you could be in a hotel anywhere, but it was done well. Wireless internet was free and worked well. There were only two drawbacks for me. First is there is only a shower, no tub.....I like a nice hot bath, so that was a bit disappointing. The other reason I marked a 4 instead of a 5 on this category is that the bed was the hardest one I've ever slept on. But neither of these are deal breakers. I would stay here again. One thing I would do differently is request a mountain view room. My room overlooked the road and the shopping mall, and the road noise could be a little loud at night. One other caveat is if you are here as a tourist, it's not really close to any of the sites you probably want to visit, and the city is large and busy enough that traffic becomes a consideration. But the hotel staff will get you a cab or make any other arrangements for you. They really take good care of the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Excelent Food”
Reviews.Author: Roccox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first time. We were greately impressed by the staff. Everything was more than perfect. The hotel is not in Downtown; however, there was no any problem to go from the hotel to any turistic place in the city. The beautiful Perisur Shopping mall "Perisur" is just across the street. The price is a bargain compared with the excellent service and facilities. We'll return for sure to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: cstimolo
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs refurbishment. It's like going back to 1970's. The carpets smell, the rooms are old fashioned, the towels and blankets are old, and the gym is absolutetly depressing (machines must have 20 years old and one of the treadmills was missing the running tape). I stayed in many Radisson hotels and this has been by far the worst one. The staff do what they can, always polite and very helpful, but the hotel is sad and gloomy.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice”
Reviews.Author: hansf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent if you're travelling on business, pleasure or both. However, before you choose, make sure you will be visiting mostly the southern part of Mexico City. Distances and traffic are important considerations for selecting a hotel in this megalopolis. This is one of the best Radissons I have stayed in, not only for the quality of the service, but also for the rooms, cleanliness and amenities. The hotel has an open space concept and the surroundings make it unique. If you forget about all the traffic and rush on Periferico Sur, you will realize this hotel is located at the edge of a quiet forested area. The lobby, restaurant and other amenities are placed with architectural views in mind. The food is very good and the service is excellent. One time I left my bags for an entire weekend to make a side trip, and picked them up three days later at no extra charge. Shopping, movies and restaurants are just across the highway through an interconnected bridge. Best of all, the building is sitting on volcanic rock, so even in an earthquake you'll have a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, perfect for business trips”
Reviews.Author: DavidAzofeifa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a work trip on late 2005, and I was very satisfied by the overall service. The hotel is in perfect conditions, everything is clean, the room was big enough, and it has a beautiful view of one of the main avenues in Mexico D.F. It is a great plus to have the huge and modern Perisur shopping center just by crossing the road (via the safe bridge). If you are in Mexico for work, this place is great to relax and take a walk in the mall. I think the only important thing it lacks, is a pool. I personally consider an indoor pool to be one of the most relaxing characteristics every hotel should have for business travelers. The same if you go with children: they are going to get tired here.

Reviews.Title: “The best five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yebina
Reviews.Content: I spent a week with my family at the end of October. All the staff were very competent and extremely nice. My 3 year old son even told one of them "you are my friend" because we had been treated so well. We were first given a room at the front of the hotel, but I thought it would be noisy, so I rang the front desk to ask for a "quiet room" and we were immediately moved to one at the back of the hotel. The view from there was fantastic. Since we were there during clear days, we were able to see the "Ajusco" volcano and Six Flags Mexico. Our package included a trip to the theme park for my children and we planned to go on the third day of our stay, however they told us in advance that Six Flags was going to close on that day, so we were able to do something else instead, and the following day they arranged the trasportation to and from the theme park. Most of the staff spoke good English and I was delighted to discover that their taxis have seat belts and are driven by excellent drivers. We used two standard taxis from the airport and from the North bus terminal and after the fright I wasn't sure how I was going to get back to the airport to get our flight back to the UK. Luckily the drivers from the Radisson proved to me on several short trips that they could get us in one piece to the airport! They were more expensive than standard taxis but to me they were more than worth it. The food at the restaurant was also great -and well priced. When we visit Mexico we tend to eat at "Sanborns" restaurants because we've never been ill and their food is nice. However the food here was superb, and for breakfast they even had a pianist playing all sorts of music, which we certainly appreciated. Another thing I liked was that they even catered for people like me with milk intolerance, so I was able to enjoy cerals with lactose-free milk. I've stayed in a couple more of five star hotels, but this hotel is the best for me!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: XLxtal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a terrific week in Mexico City (10/07). We fell in love with this huge but surprisingly clean and beautiful city. This reaction was primarily due to the excellent private guide we hired to show us the sights. Based out of the excellent Radison Paraiso, Tonatiuh Vazquez of Xanath Executive Services spoke impeccable English and pandered to our desire to spend most of our time at the archaeological attractions. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Teotihuacan pyramids, the Anthropology Museum, and the Circular Pyramid, as well as our visits to the Xochimilco boats and chinampas, Zolcolo, and the markets of San Angel. Tony provided in depth commentary about all the locations and about Mexico City in general -- and he even pulled over to get us some of the best coffee and hot chocolate in all of Mexico City!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...would stay there again and again and again!!!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaBraceface
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel...and would definitely stay there again. Service was great, the staff was great...we arrived at midnight and decided to order food at 2:00 am and they served us in our room with a smile...great job!!! Also, my brothers were able to play NINTENDO with their attached system for a small fee...they felt right at home. And the nearby shopping mall with upscale stores was just perfect for me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: 1Sausalito
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference at UNAM (University) nearby. Conference rate $100. Wireless internet $11.50 extra, fast connection. Clean, good a/c, friendly staff. Interior of hotel is pretty nice, with character unlike many large boxy hotels.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite vacations ever!”
Reviews.Author: 40thAnniversary
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Radisson Paraiso in June/July 2004. It is located near UNAM (Univ of Mex) and the 1984 Olympic Stadium/Olympic Village. Across the street is a very nice large shopping mall which you access via a foot bridge spanning the Perisur freeway. Their Sears dept store is not the same as in the U.S...it was upscale with great selections. The chain of restaurants, called Sanborn's, has one located there. A good place to eat, buy wonderful baked goods and purchase gifts. Remember, in Mexico smoking is allowed in restaurants. Our room, 9th floor, was well furnished. Marble bathroom was spacious. Would highly recommend the breakfast buffet; not free, but tasty and lots of choices. Although the hotel, mileage-wise doesn't seem far from everything, the millions of cars that travel their roads keep the freeways packed at most hours and make the trip into the city 1 1/2 hours. We were there at start of rainy season (some rain each day, but sunny too) so the smog was kept to a minimum. When using the airport, schedule your travel for late evening to avoid the crush. We were fortunate to be visiting locals who had cars to take us everywhere so we went to Teotihuacan to the pyramids and south to Taxco, the picturesque silver mining town built on a hillside, and would definitely go again. Make sure you take in the Saturday bazaar in Plaza San Jacinto, a taxi ride from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “January 8, 2004 - No Wireless Connection”
Reviews.Author: ColeenFagan
Reviews.Content: We arrived via air to Mexico City on Thursday, January 8, 2004. It took about 40 minutes from the airport to get to the Radisson Paraiso via taxi. This was at 4:55 PM The fare was $385 pesos. It is important when we travel to have internet access for our business. When I called the 800 Reservations number in the U.S. I asked if they had wireless internet connection in the room as I could not get this information from their web site. I was told by Reservations they had wireless connection in some rooms but these rooms are more expensive. $180 for the first night and $130 for the two additional nights we stayed.When we arrived at the Raddison check in was very courteous, efficient and friendly. We got to our room and there was NOT wireless internet connection. The bell boy, the front desk clerk, the Manager and the engineer all got involved trying to solve this problem. The only means of connection is with a dial up system. The engineer was kind enough to configure my lap top so I could use it in the room as I did not have a server in Mexico City. Because this type of connection is done with a regular phone, I have no idea why the extra charge for the room as all rooms have phones.If anyone needs computer access as we do for business when away from their home office, please note the Radisson Paraiso does NOT have wireless connection in the room.The beds are VERY hard.It was raining one night so we did not venture out for dinner and had a bowl of soup at the hotel restaurant. First it was cold so sent it back but even when they returned it hot, it had no flavor and did not eat it. We were not asked why it was not eaten. This was the only meal we had at the hotel but would not recommend it.The concierge was excellent and I'm sorry I did not get his name. The manager is Bejamin and did a fantastic job helping with our dilema upon arrival with the lack of wireless internet service.I have to give the entire staff an A+ for the courteous manner they handled this situation, correcting an error their reservations department made.There is a mall across the street.Sunday morning at 10:00 AM we took a taxi back to the airport to leave and it was a 20 minutes ride and $280 pesos. The exchange rate is now 11 pesos to one dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Radisson Paraiso”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in the hotel in March 2002. On a scale of 1 to 10, I'd give it a five. The check in was efficient, and the staff was friendly. They claimed not to honor my United Mileage Plus card for miles. I was too tired to argue. I asked for a non-smoking room with a single queen or king sized bed, but the only non-smoking room had two twins. The beds themselves were very hard, and the sheets were a bit stiff. The ceilings in the room were a bit low. The bathroom was pleasant, with a large shower. There was no tub. My room faced the main street, so it was noisy with the toot-toot of cars well into the evening. The hotel is on the south side of Mexico City, so if you have business in the central part of the city, you'd be better off staying in that area. The hotel is right across the street from a large shopping mall (Perisur), which has some nice stores like Zara, Liverpool, MNG, and Sears. the mall also has a cinema. The hotel offers a breakfast buffet for 110 pesos (about USD 12), with made-to-order omelets. Unfortunately, it's supposed to open at 7:00, yet was not open when I went there at 7:20. The bar has live entertainment, but when I went there on a Friday night, it was absolutely dead--I was the only customer, listening to a duo play English language pop tunes. The hotel is one of those "empty center" places, the hotel rooms facing the inside of the building. The hotel is about 40 minutes away from the airport (on a Sat morning), and 50 mins from downtown (on a weekday afternoon). The tourist cab rate from the hotel to the airport is 240 pesos.
